title: Navigate multiple related forms
description: Follow this pattern to help Veterans understand which forms come next and how to move through multiple forms without confusion.

frontMatter.title: Navigate multiple related forms
frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to help Veterans understand which forms come next and how to move through multiple forms without confusion.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern to help Veterans understand which forms come next, which are optional, and how to move through multiple forms without confusion.

when_to_use.value: **Follow-up forms.** When a Veteran's primary form submission leads to follow-up forms by identifying required vs. optional forms.
**Supporting documents.** When additional evidence or documentation must be submitted alongside the main form.
**Multi-form processes.** Guide users through multi-form processes with clear priorities.

design_principles.value: **Distinguish requirements clearly.** Use explicit language differentiating 'must complete' from optional submissions rather than relying solely on visual treatment.
**Prioritize online over PDFs.** Default linking to online form experiences with PDFs as secondary options.
**Set realistic expectations.** Provide specific timing information and explain consequences of missing deadlines.
**Group logically.** Organize forms by priority, timing, or purpose with consistent labeling.

when_not_to_use.value: **Unrelated forms.** Don't use for unrelated forms serving different purposes or benefits.
**Unclear timing.** When follow-up timing is unclear or speculative.

examples.title: Introduction page mentioning related forms
examples.description: Lists evidence needed on introduction pages before starting the form.

examples.title: Mid-form flow
examples.description: Requires additional form downloads/uploads during the form process.

examples.title: Confirmation pages with required follow-ups
examples.description: Shows required follow-up forms after submission.

examples.title: Confirmation pages with optional forms

how_to_build.intro: The pattern provides guidance on form placement and expectations.

steps.value: Use introduction pages when Veterans need documents before starting, multiple forms comprise one application, or scope understanding aids decision-making.
Use mid-form placement when user responses trigger additional form requirements.
Open required forms in new tabs to preserve progress.
Remind users on confirmation pages about any mid-form downloads.
Use confirmation pages when forms become available post-processing, specific deadlines apply, or forms are optional.
Provide in-form submission methods for supporting documents.
Allow form submission without all documents, with guidance for later submission.

content_considerations.value: Structure forms consistently. Use parallel language and formatting across form listings.
Be specific. Avoid vague language; clearly state what's required versus optional.
Link descriptively. Use meaningful link text explaining what users will find.
Explain context. Provide reasoning and timing for additional form submissions.

accessibility.value: Ensure screen readers understand form relationships from link text.
